data.message: Can we get a I'm so sorry, or my condolence button, it feels so wrong to hit a like button when someone passes away or is struggling with something, thanks....

replies.message: Thanks for the suggestion, Reggie. We're listening to all of the feedback we get from the Facebook community. If you have anymore suggestions, please let us know at: http://on.fb.me/1bc3BDo. -Chantal
I've felt the same way every time a friend or relative has died, or posted something tragic or sad. I want to show I read the post, but refrained because "Like" seemed too inappropriate.
Why don't you just commute it then a button the world lazzy as it is
I apologize. I kept getting pop-ups from Facebook telling me I had too many friends, so I started deleting everybody.  Please forgive me.
